BODY.NAME: Check trainer availability
BODY.DETAILS: This is a test task only.

SAMPLES.DESCRIPTION: The main task JSON returned for a standard task.

MARKETINGLASTCONTACTNOTE.NOTETEXT: This shows the last note added that is non-system

SAMPLES.DESCRIPTION: The main task JSON returned for a marketing task.

PARAMETERS.NAME: taskID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The ID for the task. Required for GET, PUT and DELETE. Not valid for POST requests. Can also be added to the URL, as in: api/task/:taskID

PARAMETERS.NAME: name
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The task - required when creating a new task.

PARAMETERS.NAME: details
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: Optional additional details for the task

PARAMETERS.NAME: dueDate
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The task due date. This should be set using the format: YYYY-MM-DD

PARAMETERS.NAME: ownerID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The contactID of the user responsible for the task

PARAMETERS.NAME: status
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The status for the task. Possible statuses are from 1-4. See endpoint api/task/statuses for a list of statuses

PARAMETERS.NAME: priority
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The priority for the task. Possible priorities are from 1 (Low) to 4 (Urgent). See endpoint api/task/priorities for a list

PARAMETERS.NAME: completedDate
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: Only valid for status 4 (Completed). Use format: YYYY-MM-DD

PARAMETERS.NAME: categoryID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: A category for the task. Task categories are user-defined and can be managed using the task/category endpoint.

PARAMETERS.NAME: reminderDate
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: A date and time to set an email reminder. Only valid for users with the Workflow Engine feature. Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm

PARAMETERS.NAME: PDataID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: To link a task to a workshop instance. You can also use the parameters, type='w' and instanceID

PARAMETERS.NAME: ProgramCodeID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: To link a task to a workshop type. You can also use the parameters, type='w' and ID

PARAMETERS.NAME: classID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: To link a task to a class instance. You can also use the parameters, type='p' and instanceID

PARAMETERS.NAME: diplomaID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: To link a task to a qualification or class type. You can also use the parameters, type='p' and ID

PARAMETERS.NAME: marketingLearningActivityID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: To link a task to an E-Learning instance.

PARAMETERS.NAME: marketingContactID
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: To link a task to a contact. If this field is set, the task is considered to be a marketing Follow-up task. If this field is not set, all forecast and opportunity fields will be ignored.

PARAMETERS.NAME: OpportunityStatus
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The opportunity status of a marketing task. See endpoint task/opportunityStatuses for a list of valid values. This field is required if you give the task a Forecast value

PARAMETERS.NAME: ForecastValue
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The monetary value of a task, for forecast calculation purposes.

PARAMETERS.NAME: ForecastProbability
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The percentage chance of the forecast task being converted. It must be a value between 0 and 100. If, for example, you attempt to set this value to 200 - an error will not be thrown, it will simply set it to 100.

PARAMETERS.NAME: ForecastDistribution_Month
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: Works with the ForecastDistribution_Value parameter and you can have more than one (a list). It is the forecast month. You can specify in YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD format. Day will be truncated to the first.

PARAMETERS.NAME: ForecastDistribution_Value
PARAMETERS.DESCRIPTION: The monetary value of a task for the matching ForecastDistribution_Month

DESCRIPTION: Interacts with workflow user tasks. These are tasks that can be found when going to Settings > Workflow.
